report_title: Industry Report on Acoustic and Electric Guitar Manufacturing
executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2024 currency. Acoustic and electric guitar manufacturers have endured significant volatility in recent years. Most consumers consider guitars luxury products, making sales reliant on favorable macroeconomic conditions. In recent years, new guitar sales have been negatively impacted by heightened economic uncertainty, weaker disposable income and high inflation, all of which encourage consumers to postpone discretionary purchases...

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Demand for guitars is highly dependent on the health of the economy and consumer confidence levels, largely because many consider guitars to be a luxury purchase. New guitar sales have weakened in recent years, with heightened economic uncertainty and elevated inflation pushing consumers to postpone new purchases or look at more affordable options like imports.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Demand for Domestic Producers Relies Heavily on Trade Activity
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Imports are a vital part of the US's guitar market, as companies like Fender and Gibson take advantage of fewer labor laws in Indonesia, Mexico, and China to create the most affordable guitars available. The widespread popularity of US producers in the global market has caused import penetration to weaken and exports to grow as a share of revenue despite an appreciating dollar. However, significant price advantages overseas enable imports to account for more than 40.0% of domestic demand.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Ongoing Economic Recovery Creates Growth Opportunities
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Manufacturers will benefit from the ongoing economic recovery. Improving macroeconomic conditions, including rising disposable income and cooling inflationary pressures, will allow consumers to buy more luxury products, boosting demand for new guitars.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Falling Input Prices Allow Producers to Appeal to a Broader Market
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Price competition will continue to be key to capturing a larger market share. Over the coming years, steel and wood prices are set to continue growing, although slower than in previous years. Although stabilizing input prices often translate to lower revenue growth, it also enables domestic producers to become more popular among domestic buyers looking for more affordable guitars.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Online Retailers Will Find Success With Consumers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: "Showrooming", the practice of viewing and testing a guitar in person before buying online, has become very common in recent years as it enables buyers to test the guitars before buying them while offering many of the benefits of online shopping, like home delivery.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures acoustic and electric guitars. Operators that manufacture guitar amplifiers and accessories are also included in this industry.

opportunities: High Performance Drivers: Per capita disposable income
threats: Time spent on leisure and sports

key_trends: Fender and Gibson use their established brand reputation to succeed in the guitar market. High-priced US-made guitars are long-lasting, discretionary purchases, so consumers are more wary when shopping for one.

The used guitar market is a significant competitor for new guitar sales. Many consumers prefer pre-owned, well-maintained and sometimes vintage guitars, harming new guitar purchases and impacting manufacturers' sales.

When the economy's shaky, people hold off on buying guitars, seeing them as luxury items. In recent years, elevated inflation and uncertainty have led many to push back buying a guitar or opt for cheaper imports.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Independent music stores account for over half of guitar manufacturers' revenue since consumers are more comfortable buying high-priced items in person. Music stores sell guitars and guitar-related services to a host of consumers, including professionals, amateurs, collectors and beginners looking to learn how to play the guitar.

market_segmentation.segment: Mass merchants and online and catalog retailers
market_segmentation.segment_description: Nationwide retailers like Guitar Center and Sam Ash offer shoppers a broad range of guitars to view and purchase. Stores like Costco are also included in this segment and these stores help put guitars in front of people who wouldn't typically visit a music store.

Wholesalers account for a smaller portion of revenue since most of the industry's leaders retain massive teams of employees dedicated to supplying music stores, mass merchandisers and online retailers.

products_and_services.product_description: Acoustic guitars are the go-to choice for many consumers. These guitars are convenient and need fewer accessories to play, making them perfect for beginners and on-the-go musicians.
Electric guitars use a pickup device to convert the vibration of their strings into electrical impulses, which are then sent through an amplifier to a speaker.
Accessories include effects pedals, music stands, cases, straps, tuners, strings and picks.
Amplifiers are designed for traditional and bass guitars and range in price depending on sound, quality and amplification limits.

tier_1_suppliers: Acoustic & Electric Guitar Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Sawmills & Wood Production in the US
tier_1_buyers: Musical Instrument & Supplies Stores in the US
E-Commerce & Online Auctions in the US
tier_2_buyers: Musical Instrument & Supplies Stores in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Per capita disposable income determines an individual's ability to purchase goods or services. Guitars are largely considered discretionary purchases.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Time spent on leisure and sports
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Fluctuations in the availability of consumers' leisure time directly impact demand for guitars.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Demand from musical instrument and supplies stores
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The majority of newly manufactured guitars purchased in the United States are sold in musical instrument and supplies stores.

international_trade_points.trade_title: The US is a net importer of guitars
international_trade_points.trade_description: Crafting guitars is a labor-intensive process, so many large companies take advantage of more relaxed labor laws overseas.
Indonesia has become a hub for guitar manufacturing in recent years.

international_trade_points.trade_title: Exports grow despite an appreciating dollar
international_trade_points.trade_description: Most guitars made in the US are hand-made by skilled craftsmen, resulting in them being sought-after by musicians overseas.

business_locations.location_description: The West region stands out because of its convenient access to major ports, enabling guitar companies to efficiently receive supply shipments and export finished products with relative ease.
The Great Lakes region ranks high for its concentration of manufacturing establishments.

regulations_points.regulation_title: CONVENTION ON INTERNATIONAL TRADE IN ENDANGERED SPECIES OF WILD FAUNA AND FLORA
regulations_points.regulation_description: The Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora (CITES) regulates the trade of endangered species.
The Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) enforces standards to guarantee safe working conditions.
The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) sets regulations to minimize environmental impact and protect public health.

barriers_points.barrier_description: New guitar manufacturers must comply with EPA and OSHA regulations.
Purchasing proper equipment, tooling and facilities for guitar manufacturing can be expensive.

basis_points.basis_title: Consumers are inclined to buy well-known brands
basis_points.basis_description: Fender and Gibson have established a great reputation.

basis_points.basis_title: Economies of Scale Promote Major Operations
basis_points.basis_description: Many guitar companies maintain more inexpensive brands.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Consumers are inclined to buy well-known brands
concentration_points.concentration_description: Fender and Gibson have established a great reputation.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Weaker Demand and Heightened Competition Pressure Profit
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Guitars are largely considered discretionary purchases.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: WAGE EXPENSES GROW AS REVENUE WEAKENS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Guitar manufacturers rely heavily on a well-trained staff.
Acoustic and electric guitar manufacturers source input goods.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Guitars are largely considered to be discretionary purchases
volatility_points.volatility_description: Most consumers consider guitars to be discretionary purchases.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Supply chain disruptions push prices higher
volatility_points.volatility_description: Supply chain disruptions can lead to significant delays.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Some guitars feature built-in USB or Bluetooth.
Hybrid guitars combine traditional tonewoods with alternative materials.

FAQs.question: How is your company impacted by imports from abroad?
FAQs.answer: Imports are high in the industry and typically satisfy more than a third of domestic demand.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market, or produce a range of products?
FAQs.answer: Most companies have a wide product range across a number of prices.

FAQs.question: How have input prices affected your operations?
FAQs.answer: Wood and steel are the key inputs for guitar manufacturers.

FAQs.question: Have you looked into opening manufacturing facilities in countries with lower wages?
FAQs.answer: Countries like Mexico, China and Indonesia are usually the most common source of imports.

FAQs.question: How is your company leveraging new technologies?
FAQs.answer: Fender use robots to paint their guitars.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wages by increasing automation?
FAQs.answer: The level of automation is pretty low in this industry, while wages are high.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses impacted your operations?
FAQs.answer: Compliance is primarily focused on worker safety and conditions.

FAQs.question: Are there any tariffs that have or might threaten to impact operations?
FAQs.answer: The federal government places tariffs on imported products.

FAQs.question: How do your profit margins compare with your competitors?
FAQs.answer: Large manufacturers with established brands often benefit from economies of scale.

FAQs.question: How does your company compensate for the seasonality of cash flow?
FAQs.answer: Many companies experience a jump in sales towards the end of the year.

FAQs.question: What quality-control processes do you have in effect?
FAQs.answer: Guitars assembled with quality input goods command higher retail value.

FAQs.question: Do you have a solid reputation in the marketplace?
FAQs.answer: Consumers are more likely to purchase guitars from a company with a well-established brand name.

FAQs.question: Does your company keep up to date with the latest technology?
FAQs.answer: Manufacturers of electric and acoustic guitars must stay abreast of new recording software.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor the trade-weighted index?
FAQs.answer: If the value of the US dollar increases, US goods become less attractive to foreign markets.

FAQs.question: What percentage of demand comes from the musical instrument and supplies market?
FAQs.answer: The majority of newly manufactured guitars purchased in the United States are sold in musical instrument and supplies stores.

FAQs.question: Do you expect major changes in demand as a result of rising disposable income levels?
FAQs.answer: A rise in disposable income increases the propensity for consumers to purchase industry goods.
